body_html:
Both don't allocate anything, but they do different things (list(tensor) will give you a list of slices along the first dim, tensor.tolsit() will recursively convert all dimensions).

The memory increase (from 2MB to ~220MB) is just the NVIDIA driver initializing the device. It initializes the current one when cudaMemcpy is called, even if the copy is completely unrelated to the current GPU.

body:
Both don't allocate anything, but they do different things (`list(tensor)` will give you a list of slices along the first dim, `tensor.tolsit()` will recursively convert all dimensions).

The memory increase (from 2MB to ~220MB) is just the NVIDIA driver initializing the device. It initializes the current one when `cudaMemcpy` is called, even if the copy is completely unrelated to the current GPU.
